properties.media:imagetext:
Safety
Information
B737
Please inform a crew member
if you are sitting in an exit row
and you cannot see well enough
to read this card or follow these
instructions
Si vous êtes assis dans une rangée de sièges à côté d'une
sortie, et vous ne comprenez pas la langue anglaise,
veuillez le dire à un membre de l'équipage.
Si usted se encuentra sentado/a en una fila de asientos
Viscount Air an e dead .
a la par de una salida u usted no entiende el idioma inglés,
Wenn sie neben einem ausgang sitzen und sie verstehen
kein Englisch, bitte verständigen sie die flugzeugbesatzung.
PASSENGER SELECTION CRITERIA FOR EXIT SEATING
Viscount Air Services may not seat an individual in an exit seat if it appears likely that the person would
be unable to perform one or more of the emergency exit seat duties. Individuals seated in the exit
seat must have the ability to:
1. Hear and understand instructions in English related to emergency evacuation given by a Flight Attendant,
without the assistance of more than a hearing aid.
2. Read and understand instructions in English related to emergency evacuation in printed or graphic
form without the assistance of more than contact lenses or prescription glasses.
3. Communicate to other passengers and crewmembers orally in the event of an emergency.
4. Locate, operate, and stow emergency exit doors.
5. Remove obstructions similar in size and weight to overwing exit doors and maintain balance while
removing such obstructions.
6. Assess safety conditions outside the aircraft and activate and stabilize the emergency evacuation slide.
7. Get around obstacles and lead other passengers from the aircraft in the event of an emergency.
8. Adequately assist in an emergency without endangering or harming themselves.
NOTE: Passengers seated with and responsible for the care of small children may not sit in an exit seat.
Passengers must be at least 15 years old to qualify for exit seating.
EMERGENCY EXIT SEAT DUTIES
In the event of an emergency in which a crewmember is not available to assist, a passenger occupying an
exit seat may be called upon to perform the following duties:
1. Locate the emergency exit and recognize the opening mechanism.
2. Comprehend the instructions for operating the emergency exit.
3. Assess whether opening the emergency exit will increase the hazards to which passengers may be exposed.
4. Operate the emergency exit.
5. Follow oral directions and hand signals given by crewmembers.
6. Stow or secure the emergency exit door so that it will not hinder use of the exit.
7. Assess conditions of the escape slide, activate the slide, and stabilize the slide after deployment to assist
others in getting off the slide.
8. Pass quickly through the emergency exit.
9. Select a safe path away from the aircraft.
Please ask to be reseated by the Gate Agent or Flight Attendant if you are assigned an emergency exit
seat and fall into one of the following categories:
1. Cannot meet the slection criteria outlined above.
2. Have a nonvisible or unnoticeable condition that would prevent you from performing the duties listed.
3. May suffer bodily harm as a result of assisting in an emergency evacuation.
4. Do not wish to perform the exit seat duties in the event of an emergency.
Please do not remove this card from airplane. Follow these instructions, the directions of crewmembers,
and placarded signs.
